name: Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project
description:
{"link": "https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021", "retrievedDate": "14-April-2022", "additionalInfo": "The Global Carbon Budget dataset is available at https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021 and https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5569235.

Andrew, Robbie M., & Peters, Glen P. (2021). The Global Carbon Project's fossil CO2 emissions dataset [Data set]. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5569235.

name: Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project, BP and Shift Energy Data Portal
description:
{"link": "https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021", "retrievedDate": "14-April-2022", "additionalInfo": "The Global Carbon Budget dataset is available at https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021 and https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5569235.

Full references:

Global Carbon Project. (2021). Supplemental data of Global Carbon Project 2021 (1.0) [Data set]. Global Carbon Project. https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021.

Andrew, Robbie M., & Peters, Glen P. (2021). The Global Carbon Project's fossil CO2 emissions dataset [Data set]. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5569235.

Our World in Data have renamed the category "bunker fuels" as "International transport" for improved clarity, which includes emissions from international aviation and shipping.

Primary energy consumption figures are sourced from BP and Shift Energy Data Portal. Link: https://www.bp.com/en/global/corporate/energy-economics/statistical-review-of-world-energy, https://www.theshiftdataportal.org/energy", "dataPublishedBy": "Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project, BP and Shift Energy Data Portal", "dataPublisherSource": "Global Carbon Project, BP and Shift Energy Data Portal"}

name: Global Carbon Project
description:
{"link": "https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021", "retrievedDate": "14-April-2022", "additionalInfo": "The Global Carbon Budget dataset is available at https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021 and https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5569235.

Full references:

Global Carbon Project. (2021). Supplemental data of Global Carbon Project 2021 (1.0) [Data set]. Global Carbon Project. https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021.

Andrew, Robbie M., & Peters, Glen P. (2021). The Global Carbon Project's fossil CO2 emissions dataset [Data set]. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5569235.

Our World in Data have renamed the category "bunker fuels" as "International transport" for improved clarity, which includes emissions from international aviation and shipping.

Consumption-based CO2 emissions have been constructed by the Global Carbon Project using the methodology described in:

Peters, GP, Minx, JC, Weber, CL and Edenhofer, O 2011. Growth in emission transfers via international trade from 1990 to 2008. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences 108, 8903-8908. http://www.pnas.org/content/108/21/8903.abstract", "dataPublishedBy": "Global Carbon Budget - Global Carbon Project (v2021)", "dataPublisherSource": "Global Carbon Project"}

name: Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project
description:
{"link": "https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021", "retrievedDate": "14-April-2022", "additionalInfo": "The Global Carbon Budget dataset is available at https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021 and https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5569235.

Andrew, Robbie M., & Peters, Glen P. (2021). The Global Carbon Project's fossil CO2 emissions dataset [Data set]. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5569235.

Our World in Data have renamed the category "bunker fuels" as "International transport" for improved clarity, which includes emissions from international aviation and shipping.

Population figures are sourced from Gapminder (v6), HYDE (v3.2), United Nations Population Division (2019). Links: https://www.gapminder.org/data/documentation/gd003/; https://population.un.org/wpp/Download/Standard/Population/; https://dataportaal.pbl.nl/downloads/HYDE/

Consumption-based CO2 emissions have been constructed by the Global Carbon Project using the methodology described in:

Peters, GP, Minx, JC, Weber, CL and Edenhofer, O 2011. Growth in emission transfers via international trade from 1990 to 2008. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences 108, 8903-8908. http://www.pnas.org/content/108/21/8903.abstract", "dataPublishedBy": "Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project", "dataPublisherSource": "Global Carbon Project"}

name: Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project and Maddison Project Database 2020 (Bolt and van Zanden, 2020)
description:
{"link": "https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021", "retrievedDate": "14-April-2022", "additionalInfo": "The Global Carbon Budget dataset is available at https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2021 and https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5569235.

Our World in Data have renamed the category "bunker fuels" as "International transport" for improved clarity, which includes emissions from international aviation and shipping.

GDP figures are sourced from Bolt, Jutta and Jan Luiten van Zanden (2020), “Maddison style estimates of the evolution of the world economy. A new 2020 update“. Link: https://www.rug.nl/ggdc/historicaldevelopment/maddison/releases/maddison-project-database-2020

Peters, GP, Minx, JC, Weber, CL and Edenhofer, O 2011. Growth in emission transfers via international trade from 1990 to 2008.
